required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: RCT Ventralex vs Onlay Mesh in Incisional Hernias
clinical_study.official_title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Ventralex Versus Onlay Mesh Repair for Midline Incisional Hernias

brief_summary.textblock: A radomised controlled trial comparing Ventralex patch and Progrip mesh in surgery for midline incisional hernias

detailed_description.textblock:
Incisional hernias in the midline is among the most common conditions requiring surgery. There are several factors which can increase the risk of incisional hernias, e.g. surgical technique, truncal obesity and other co-morbidities.
Repair with mesh-reinforcement is considered standard for the treatment of incisional hernias. Onlay and sublay mesh placements are the most commonly used methods. There are many different types of mesh available to use. Despite the widely use of composite ventral-patch Ventralex, there are few studies with small numbers of patients showing the advantage and disadvantage of ventral-patch. Some studies show that the onlay mesh-reinforcement remains a good alternative to the sublay mesh technique, while others showing fewer recurrences with the sublay mesh technique. The Ventralex mesh is usually placed on the peritoneum as a Intra peritoneum onlay mesh (IPOM). In this study intend to compare pre peritoneal VentralexÂ® mesh in sublay position with ProGrip self-fixating onlay mesh.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomised controlled trial of Vantralex versus Progrip for repair of midline incisional hernias
study_design_info.masking_description: The patient and staff responsible for the postoperative care of the patient are masked to the acollcation.

primary_outcome.description: Rate of hernia recurrences diagnosed at clinical and/or radiologic examination

secondary_outcome.description: Rate of complications occurring during or after the repair
Pain interfering with daily activities as rated with Ventral Hernia Pain Questionnaire
Mean number of postoperative days sick leave

clinical_study.condition: Incisional Hernia of Midline of Abdomen

arm_group.description: Repair with Ventralex patch in sublay position
Repair with Progrip in Onlay position

intervention.description: Repair of the hernia by a Ventralex patch in sublay position
Repair of the hernia by a Progrip mesh in onlay position

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hernia defect 1-4 cm
- Incisional hernia or recurrent hernia after previous primary hernia repair
- BMI <35
- Age 18-100 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Defect size>4 cm
- Ongoing pregnancy
- BMI>35
- Primary hernia
